title: What makes an Ibanez guitar better than other top name brand guitars on the market? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is difficult to answer that without knowing which Ibanez you are talking about specifically. If it is the RG, PG, JEM series, then they can be at par with many good guitar brands out there. Better? I am not so sure. Fenders are always great those glassy, neck-pick-up-y sounds that is excellent for traditional blues and rock n roll. Gibsons have great tone and legacy too (some of the recent build quality has been questionable but that’s for another day) I think it’s the Ibanez’s versatility which works well. The HSH pick-up configuration with the five-way selector gives you a lot of options. Ibanez from Team J Craft (the guitar I am fortunate to own) has just tremendous build quality. The trem control is perfect and the feel is good too. Is it better than the other guitars of that range? Since this is the Team J Craft model, I can say probably but its a tough bet. If you are looking for a overall shreddy sound with plenty of in-guitar tone options and good trem control, Ibanez’s good. But then I have heard that the latest Edge Tremolo is bad. So I don’t know :-) It’s all about what sound you are chasing.

I'm a Fender Strat./Telly guy. I have a few Ibanez guitars 🎸🎸🎸 . They are great guitars. What makes any mass produced guitars is quality control. Ibanez has great quality control. And sometimes you get lucky. Like I bought my Fender Telecaster for $149.00 + tax. I play Maggie , the most out of my collection. I have some more expensive guitars. Maggie, she the one. I'm always reaching for!!! P.S. Always look for quality control tags on guitars. These guitars are set up perfectly!!! To specs. I have three quality control tag guitars. They all play better than some very high end guitars.

I don’t think that they are. Some Ibanez models are as good as many other brands and models but they are hardly the best. If anyone tries to convince you that they are then they are just blowing smoke up your butt. I have owned several Ibanez guitars but I never really seem to hold onto them because I have others I liked much better. For example Paul Reed Smith to me is a much better guitar and even the less expensive PRS models to me are better than many Ibanez guitars. Currently I don’t own a single Ibanez. Don’t get me wrong Ibanez does make a fine guitar but they are far from the best. For me the Ibanez guitars made in Japan in the 70’s and 80’s were some of the best guitars they ever produced. Even some of the 90’s guitars were very nice. I had an Ibanez Ghostrider with P-90’s that I loved, I had a Iceman that I wish I still had but I wasn’t too sad to sell my Jem just because I prefer a fixed bridge over a Floyd Rose. I’ve had other Ibanez guitars as well but I had no real attachment to many of them but they were good guitars.

You If a Ibanez feels best to you and inspires you it's the best for you. Personally…I couldn't get comfortable with any I tried…. including an acoustic I used to own. Too thin of a neck makes MY hand cramp. For me what makes for a superior guitar is comfort, sound and what fits the song/mix best. Sometimes it's my strat, sometimes one of my telecaster's(I have 2 because I keep 1 in open G tuning). Sometimes it's my LP and sometimes my SG. And of course sometimes NOTHING works better than 1 of my acoustics.
